author: MSNBC.com
title: Detroit bus driver dies two weeks after raising alarms about COVID-19
description: Jason Hargrove, a bus driver in Detroit, raised alarms about COVID-19 after picking up a coughing passenger. Sadly, Hargrove was infected with coronavirus and died less than two weeks later.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: The terrifying trend of coronavirus in nursing homes
description: NBC News editor Benjy Sarlin tells the story of how his father contracted coronavirus in a nursing home in New York.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MPX
title: See Trump's ego-driven virus response called out on live TV by...
description: As people adjust to life during the coronavirus pandemic, many artists are performing from home, speaking out and even releasing new work, as Grammy...
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Jared Kusher ‘doesn’t know what the hell he’s talking about:’ commander of Katrina Task Force
description: Lt. General Russel Honore, commander of Joint Task Force Katrina, on Jared Kushner saying that distributing lifesaving materials from the federal stockpile is not the government's job: “He doesn’t know what the hell he’s talking about. He’s totally clueless.”
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Infectious disease expert's plan to crush coronavirus in 10 weeks
description: Harvey Fineberg, the former Deal of the Harvard School of Public Health, joins to detail his plan to crush the coronavirus curve in ten weeks.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MPX
title: NYT: Trump administration scales back paid leave in relief bill
description: Robert Reich tells Ali Velshi that the Trump administration’s decision to exempt small businesses from providing paid leave to 75% of workers puts them “in an impossible position” to choose between going to work or missing a paycheck. He also discusses how di…

author: MSNBC.com
title: Chairman Schiff reacts to Trump firing Intel IG
description: Chairman Adam Schiff tells Ali Velshi that Donald Trump’s late-Friday-night firing of the Inspector General who flagged the whistleblower complaint to Congress is the president “retaliating against the people that are on his enemies list.”
content: Chairman Adam Schiff tells Ali Velshi that Donald Trumps late-Friday-night firing of the Inspector General who flagged the whistleblower complaint to Congress is the president retaliating against the people that are on his enemies list.April 4, 2020

author: MSNBC.com
title: Maddow to Trump: You had one job. Coronavirus response needs competent leadership
description: Rachel Maddow points out for Donald Trump the failures of the George W. Bush administration in dealing with the disaster of Hurricane Katrina and encourage him to recognize his own administration's fecklessness as COVID-19 is killing thousands of Americans an…
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Trump firing IG who flagged complaint that triggered impeachment
description: Robert Costa of The Washington Post explains the significance to Trump telling Congress he is firing the inspector general who flagged the Ukraine whistleblower complaint that eventually led to the president's impeachment.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MPX
title: Trump fires IG who flagged Ukraine whistleblower complaint
description: NBC News’ Ken Dilanian reports breaking news about Donald Trump’s removing Intelligence Community Inspector General Michael Atkinson.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MPX
title: Dr. Rishi Desai: Testing is crucial to fight COVID-19
description: Dr. Rishi Desai, a former Epidemic Intelligence Service Officer at the CDC, explains to Ali Velshi that almost everyone in America might have COVID-19 and the importance of testing to fight the spread and reoccurrence of the virus.
content: Dr. Rishi Desai, a former Epidemic Intelligence Service Officer at the CDC, explains to Ali Velshi that almost everyone in America might have COVID-19 and the importance of testing to fight the spread and reoccurrence of the virus.April 4, 2020

author: MSNBC.com
title: Trump calls himself a 'wartime president' while dodging responsibility
description: While Trump has referred to himself as a 'wartime president' as the nation deals with the coronavirus pandemic, he has repeatedly shifted blame to governors describing the federal government as a 'backup' to states. Annie Karni of The New York Times discusses.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Trump blasts states and fights with media as coronavirus deaths soar
description: Trump continued to blast states, fight with reporters, and flout the CDC's own new guidance on the coronavirus at the end of a relentless week.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: CDC changes guidance, now says people should wear face coverings when outside
description: The Centers for Disease Control is now recommending that people wear non-medical face coverings when they go out in public. Medical experts say N95 and surgical masks should be left to health care workers, but for general use, a bandana or homemade mask can h…
source.name: MSNBC

author: MPX
title: All In 4/3/20
description: Chris Hayes discusses the day's top political news.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Rutger Bregman: ‘We have to design our institutions based on trust’
description: Historian Rutger Bregman argues that there’s never been a better time to offer universal basic income to Americans.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Cuomo announces New York is receiving new ventilators from Oregon and China
description: New York Governor Andrew Cuomo announced that New York will be receiving donations of ventilators from the state of Oregon and China to help coronavirus relief efforts.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Velshi: America needs universal healthcare
description: MSNBC’s Ali Velshi on why employer-based healthcare coverage doesn’t make sense.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Fmr. Dept. of Labor Chief Economist: 'We have not seen joblessness rates of this magnitude'
description: U.S. Dept. of Labor former chief economist William Rodgers and podcast host Pete Dominick discuss how to help Americans brought to the edge of bankruptcy by the pandemic.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Kushner 'has no idea what he's doing' political reporter states
description: Jared Kushner's statements on who controls the national stockpile of medical supplies have sparked outrage, as many people believe he implied that the precious resources needed to fight the coronavirus pandemic belong to the federal government and not states.…
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Ali Velshi: We need better methods to get people money
description: Coronavirus relief checks could take weeks to come, as not everyone has direct deposit, MSNBC host Ali Velshi tells Joy Reid, adding 'direct payments to people would be more efficient.'
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Cruise ship with passengers who tested positive for coronavirus docks in Florida
description: The Coral Princess, a cruise ship that has passengers who tested positive for coronavirus, has docked in Florida. Rep. Debbie Mucarsel-Powell, D-Fla., talks to Alex Witt about how her district is handling these ships docking with patients on board.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Sen. Gillibrand addresses racial disparity of coronavirus impact
description: The coronavirus pandemic's disproportionately higher impact on communities of color is discussed by Sen. Kirsten Gillibrand (D-NY) who tells Joy Reid 'institutional racism' in healthcare and the economy is likely partially blame.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: NYC Mayor: Coronavirus will be like many Katrinas across U.S.
description: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio discusses the coronavirus outbreak in his city, as deaths from the pandemic start to surpass 2,000, telling Joy Reid, 'this is like the equivalent of being in a war.'
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Mehdi Hasan: Gov. DeSantis is a 'Trump mini-me'
description: Senior Intercept columnist Mehdi Hasan and former Republican Representative David Jolly of Florida discuss how the governor bungled the coronavirus response.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Undocumented house cleaner in Seattle: ‘I have no money at all if I get sick’
description: House cleaner Jonny of Seattle shares his story alongside National Domestic Workers Alliance executive director Ai-Jen Poo.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Intelligence expert on Atkinson firing: 'Trump's middle name is retribution'
description: Former U.S. Navy Senior Chief Petty Officer Malcolm Nance says Pres. Trump punished inspector general Michael Atkinson for calling out corruption in the intelligence community.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Rep. Gallego on dismissal of coronavirus whistleblower captain
description: Coronavirus whistleblo​wer, Navy Captain Francis Crozier, who was dismissed after attempting to protect the women and men under his command from the spread of the pandemic, is discussed by Rep. Ruben Gallego--an Iraq war vet.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Govs. DeSantis, Kemp criticized for their coronavirus responses
description: The relatively slower coronavirus responses of Florida Gov. DeSantis and other conservative governors--plus the likely fallout--is critiqued by Joy Reid's panel.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Has Trump replaced his rallies with coronavirus briefings?
description: Michael Kruse of Politico and Alex Witt discuss the effect of President Donald Trump's daily press briefings - and if they've taken the place of his campaign rallies.
source.name: MSNBC

title: Trump: Inspector general who flagged whistleblower complaint 'is a disgrace'
description: President Trump called Michael Atkinson, the inspector general who flagged the whistleblower complaint that lead to his impeachment 'a disgrace.'
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Trump: "There will be a lot of death" due to COVID-19 in the coming weeks
description: President Trump warns the country to prepare for the "a lot of deaths" as the coronavirus is expected to reach its peak in the coming weeks.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: 'COVID Tech Connect' uses smart devices to connect coronavirus patients with family
description: Sara Rodell, partner for COVID Tech Connect, talks to Alicia Menendez about the 'Dignity Project', which involves purchasing tablets for hospitals to allow COVID-19 patients to connect with their families during their time in their hospital.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Giving birth and holding funerals: Life and loss during a pandemic
description: Trymaine Lee reports on what it's like for families to experience the birth of a child and the loss of a loved one during the COVID-19 pandemic.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: New York AG leads coalition to stop Texas abortion ban during COVID-19 pandemic
description: New York Attorney General Letitia James talks to Alicia Menendez about leading a multi-state coalition challenging Texas' abortion ban during the COVID-19 pandemic, which has already been overturned and re-instated by federal courts.
source.name: MSNBC
